Reviews.Title: “Best Receptionist! and ...”
Reviews.Author: Stuart K
Reviews.Content: If every member of staff was as good as Marion L, Mercure group would make a fortune! The welcome was not only efficient but very friendly. Marion went out of her way to help us as we needed extra assistance both on arrival & on occasions during our stay. She is one of the best receptionists I have come across! The hotel is well run, well situated (very convenient for Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge etc and the Place Clichy metro) and of good design. The only slight disappointment was the breakfast in the 1st floor restaurant. The organisation in this area could be improved and the full breakfast cost was not good value. The breakfast in the bar ("Express & Co" brand) on the other hand was very good and good value at 8 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, handy for Metro and Restaurants......”
Reviews.Author: stugrmi
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly plush for the money we paid, Complimentary safe and Kettle in the room was a nice touch, clean comfortable rooms, well decorated, Staff were helpful and polite, we didnt eat here as there is so much to choose from outside. A good value Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: tunein
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and found the hotel good, clean, tidy and the members of staff helpful. Now, after reading some negative comments posted here, I wonder if this is the same hotel visited. The breakfast was good and fulfilling. I do not know what some people expect from a breakfast. The area was nice with plenty of affordable restaurants and very close to the metro station, Place de Clichy, that gets you anywhere in Paris. I have been to other Mercure hotels and I can say that the level of this chain is good,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location – terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern, chain hotel in an interesting area – the Mercure fits the bill. We stayed in a superior / privilege room on the 8th floor. It was clean and modern, although my partner thought it was lacking in soul. Even the air-conditioning worked (although it could have been a bit cooler for my tastes). It was spotlessly clean but there was no cupboard/drawer space – just an open closet area. For a Paris hotel, it was a reasonable size. I found the large bed and pillows very, very comfortable. The shower strength was very good, although due to the bath/shower design, the water leaked all over the place. Good thing I asked for extra towels on arrival. As previous reviewers have mentioned, the toilet is in a separate cubicle. As we were in a privilege room, bathrobes and slippers were provided along with an espresso pod machine and a small fridge containing complimentary soft drinks – 1 bottle of still, 1 bottle of sparkling, 1 bottle of orange juice, 1 can of coke, 1 can of Diet Coke. I liked the quality of the bathroom amenities. The staff were very welcoming and accommodating and seemed genuinely concerned about our stay. It is a short walk to lots of restaurants, bars and shopping areas – the location is excellent. However, do not under any expenses pay extra for the breakfast, unless you can get a good B&B rate. It nearly ruined what could have been a near-perfect stay. The breakfast room was chaos. There were too few staff tending to the needs of their guests. The food was average to poor quality at best and there was a huge line to get coffee or tea -- it was a mad scrum. The hotel didn’t seem that busy during our stay so the lack of preparation was alarming -- I'm afraid my overall rating dropped because of this. Despite our disappointing breakfast experience, I would certainly consider staying at this property again if I could get a good rate. By North American standards it is a modern, 3-star complex.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in central location”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend at the hotel. Montmartre area is a reasonable area to stay in (its not one of the poshest neighborhoods but the Metro system is relatively easy to use to get around). Our room has been recently renovated by the looks of the decor - clean and tidy. Staff were helpful, breakfasts were busy (but there was a major sports event nearby that weekend). Bed was so-so on the comfort side. TV and lighting of a good standard. Room was quiet (but we were at the rear of the hotel away from the main road). Minus points - bath/shower was too small and plasticcy and the shower was located too far back from the bath to be used properly. All in all an OK hotel for the price / location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad restaurant”
Reviews.Author: beninbrighton
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed most aspects of this hotel. Nice friendly staff (on the whole) and good sized room. I thought the location was convenient for getting around. Experience was spoilt by very rude restaurant staff, our table was cleared whilst we were choosing our food, and then the staff proceeded to have an argument with us about it across the whole restaurant so everyone could hear us! We complained to the manager who was very nice and took the charge for the meals off the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay and Good Service!”
Reviews.Author: toujours1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a short weekend in Paris (I live in London) due to it's proximity to Montmartre, which is my favourite area. Although it is located on the Place de Clichy, which is a bit of a tacky area, it's just a 5 minute walk to the lovely Rue Lepic/Abbesses area. It's also close to many cute restaurants just up Rue Caulaincourt. The hotel's lobby needs to be updated, as it is not as stylish as the newly renovated rooms (floors 4 and up). The front desk staff was excellent, especially a young woman named Marion who was very cheerful and helpful. The check in was quick and effecient. The room was very clean and modern, and everything was recently renovated. The ONLY complaint I have about the room is the hair dryer! If you want to style your hair, bring your own...theirs is attached to the wall and not very good! We also had the breakfast included, and it was good and pretty copious. We had it brought to our room and the service was very quick + with a smile. It included about 4 small pastries per person, yogurt, fruit, jams, butter, coffee and hot milk, and a fruit compote. All in all, I think this is a very strong Mercure hotel, and would recommend it to anyone who wants a sure value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, great location, free internet”
Reviews.Author: Ramon I
Reviews.Content: The Mercure in Montmartre is a solid hotel at a great location. It is in walking distance to several touristic sights like Sacre Coeur and Moulin rouge. The room price was reasonable, breakfast was very good. Overall if you are ok to stay in a solid hotel, nothing fancy but clean and ok modern Mercure is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer relationship management”
Reviews.Author: KayDude
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel a month before I was due to arrive, and upon booking I explicitly asked to be put on a room on the top floor so I can get a view of the Eiffel Tower. I made all the payments and thought everything was sorted. When I arrived at the hotel they informed me that the rooms on the top floors are "Premium" whereas my room was "Standard" and that if I wanted a room on the top floors I'd need to pay 50 Euro per night extra. I was appalled, not least because none of that was mentioned when I was making my bookings. I also made sure my request went in writing to them a month in advance, surely at some point in that month they would have found the decency to inform me of that. Even if that were not to happen, at least offer me some sort of concession when I arrive at the hotel! Instead, they put me in the worst room possible, on the first floor near the breakfast room overlooking some kebab shop, from what I can see, because a wall was almost half way up the window. It's right on the street so it's loud and busy, just horrible. Now Im not one to complain about small stuff here and there, I find people to do that to be quite pedantically irritating, but my room was just all over the place. The toilet wasn't even one room! The toilet and showers were in separate rooms! The toilet didn't even have basic things like toilet paper! After the cleaning lady cleaned the room, she forgot not only forgot to replace the towels, but also no soaps and shampoo! Cleanliness wasn't great either, the hallways had bad smells throughout, especially that I'm close to the kitchen, the place smelled of cookery and oils at all times! Location-wise, you should know that this building is quite literally on the border between Montmartre and Opera, I wouldn't classify it as Montmartre. The basilica is a good 15-20 minute steep hill walk away. The area is very dirty, which is expected, I mean we are talking about Boulevard Clichy here, don't expect this to be Montmartre proper, it's on the border, but you don't me to tell you that, just grab a map. I just think this place lacked basic courtesy to it's guests. Okay, so my room is standard, and I didnt even know, that's not the problem, but they could offer alternatives, and no paying 50 euros a night is not one that I consider to be courteous! The only good thing about the place for me was the free wifi at all times, which was pleasant, but I wouldn't recommend that place to anyone, just bad treatment, I certainly won't be coming back to any mercure hotel any time soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: AWal02
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel the buzz around moulin rouge in the evenings is amazing! If I returned I would definitely book a deluxe room as the standard rooms are very dated despite being kept clean. The breakfast was very good and staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pollynufc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and decided to upgrade our room to the priviledge room, which I'd highly recommend paying the extra for. We were offered either a view of he eiffel tower or the sacre coeur, to which we chose the eiffel tower. The view from the room was spectacular and being so high up we couldn't really hear any traffic noise either. The room was clean and modern with an expresso machine and flat screen tv. We had a huge double bed which was unbelievably comfortable, everytime I got in it, I had a fantastic sleep! The buffet breakfast had a great selection of breads and meat, as well as some hot options like eggs and pancakes. The hotel was only a 2 minute walk from the metro station which linked us to the rest of the city. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Paris without paying through the roof prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Madicasper
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mercure Montmartre was wonderful! The rooms were very clean, the front desk staff was exceptional. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. We asked for an upgrade with a view and was given a room on the 7th floor with a view of Sacre Couer. Our upgrade was only 20 euros per night and well worth it. This hotel made our stay in Paris wonderful!! Make sure you get the bed and breakfast option. The breakfast was well worth it and the additional cost was negligible!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good for business visit.”
Reviews.Author: ChEklund
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with good location. The room was maybe a bit small but works. Fresh breakfast, liked it!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaMara P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, seriously, I can't say enough about it! Great location, great view from most rooms, and in the heart of Montmartre. Stayed in this hotel in July 2011 as part of a trip with my family through grand circle travel, and I loved it. Great breakfast, beautiful and modern decor, bathroom was spacious...and bathtub?? That is RARE. Cool neon lighting too! Very clean, friendly and helpful staff (Parisians can be kind of jerks sometimes...but everyone in the area was very helpful) and loved the convenience of the location. Literally a minute walk from the metro and a few blocks from Sacre Coeur. Safety was a big plus...as a 20 year old in Paris...I felt safe walking around by myself during day time and early evening. Quiet, never noisy. Stay here if you have the opportunity, promise...you won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room!”
Reviews.Author: engineerJ87
Reviews.Content: My review is helped by the fact I was upgraded to the King Room...but what a room. Spacious, huge comfy bed, shower AND bath, and room to put a suitcase on the floor...this is luxury by Paris standards. More than friendly FOH staff. I was extremely impressed with everything at this hotel. Great value for money and will revisit this place next time I'm in Paris without a second thought. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Hexagone6x6
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice location (close to Montmartre attractions), friendly staff. Good hotel choice in Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located an quiet hotel near the areas we intended to visit (Montmartre, Moulin Rouge) and with easy access top other key areas of Paris (metro lines). very clean hotel and rooms. Rooms are well appointed and despite teh relative small size, compared to Asia hotel rooms, there was ample space for a King size bed and a single bed for our daughter. Reception staff was very friendly and helpful. Public parking is available next to hotel. It is not under hotel management and can be pricey (21 Euros per day).

Reviews.Title: “My Lovely Stay In Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff by the name of Khalil is very helpful and knowledgeable in all aspect. I would highly recommend promotion for this person as he deserves it. The price which is 50% off the normal rate is just right for our budget. Food and beverages are around the corner and there is no problem at all for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Shopping mall like Printemp and La Fayette is about 1 or 2 km away. You can walk with ease to the said areas. Moulin Rouge is nearby ie 240m from the hotel and you should not miss it. You can also join the Montmartre walking tour which takes you on a walk of the area.

Reviews.Title: “As average as they come”
Reviews.Author: hippo117
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic and has about as much charm as a motorway service station. The location is close to a metro station, and a short walk from the Sacré Coeur. However it's in much closer proximity to the seedy sex district, complete with prostitutes, sex shops and dirty old men. Obviously this is the down side of having the Moulin Rouge on your doorstep. The rooms are quite big, with a nice modern bathroom. The hotel did make a mistake with our booking (giving us a 2 singles as opposed to a double), but it was resolved fairly quickly if not entirely professionally (gave us a double sheet). The staff were some of the friendliest people we met in Paris, although this is in part due to just how rude the general populous are. A hotel that is better suited to a stag do than a romantic weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, but room for noise improvement”
Reviews.Author: Database M
Reviews.Content: The location is indeed very comfortable, only a 5 minute walk from the Clichy metro station. The surroundings are nice, and even for business travellers it is an enlightment to have a stroll outside in the evening hours after work. There are also some great restaurants in the area. The staff is correct and formal. The room is modern and up-to-date (I had a room on the 7th floor). I asked for a no-noise room as I always do when travelling. But this needs improvement for sure. During the evening and night, I was able to hear toilets, coughing from a neighbour next to me and doors being slammed. If you have difficulties sleeping like me, it is adviced to bring your earplugs. Breakfast is chaotic: not enough seats, the choice of food is ok but the staff is not professional, fast and hospitable during breakfast hour. Overall, a 3 star as the location is good, the staff (check-in) is ok, but room for improvement. I will be staying here again on Thursday so let's see if improvements are possible.

Reviews.Title: “Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant hotel located in city area of Paris. Small but cosy hotel. Staff are courteous. Only European channels on TV. It would be great if slippers and shower caps/bath robes be provided.

Reviews.Title: “No sahaver, no hairdrier”
Reviews.Author: almufti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel four nights early this month. The first morning I discovered that the shaver outlet and the hair drier are not working, maybe for some electrical fault. I reported this to the reception and promissed to look after this problem soon. Unfortunately nothing was done in spite of my repeated claims to the reception each morning till my departure. As for the rooms the carpet was old and stained. The breakfast tables were very close with no space between the opposite chairs. The breakfast choices were limited and dose not worth its rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Vasios
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Nov 2011, we were welcomed very warmly by the reception staff who answered all our questions about location and local transportation very warmly. The rooms are obviously recently renovated and have a feeling of modern design. Yes, you should try to get a room in 8 or 9 floor as the view obvioulsy worths it. There is also a parking garage underground the hotel which is a separate bussiness and it costs 21€ per 24h. Pricey, but I guess this is paris. Only downside was the average and limited breakfast in my opinion. In any case i would say that the hotel is a safe choice in the area, and I would definately book it again if I revisit paris and want to stay in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “November in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with nearby transport links. Easy walking distance from the main Monmartre area. Very pleasant rooms, comfortable, well equipped and very clean. Very helpful reception staff. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Also, nice bar area.

Reviews.Title: “We keep going back”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel have stayed there many times before and will return. Great location ideally placed for sight seeing. Our room on the 9th floor had fantastic views over Paris and worth paying a little extra for. Best part of our stat was the room and views over Paris, worst part nothing too bad but did come across a sulky bar tender at the end of his shift who was clearly ready to go home. However his replacement more than made up for it and this was a minor incident was really rather amusing. It certainly did not cause upset and we were quite sympathetic, who hasn't had days like it ?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor!!”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel_0107
Reviews.Content: We were here in May 2011 with a group tour. I loved the colors of the room so well, I came home and used them to re-decorate our guest room. I loved the black-out curtains, that allowed us to sleep in when we wanted. This hotel is located very close to the subway and within walking distance of lots of things. We loved our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jcle5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of the Montmarte area. This is where Sacre Cuoer Church is located. The hotel is on the busline that takes you directly to The Louve. Another bus from the Louve takes you directly to the Eiffel Tower. Great hotel breakfast buffet and nice rooms. A good supply of restaurants, bars and a grocery store are within a couple of blocks. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Visiting again”
Reviews.Author: Manan_107
Reviews.Content: This place is really cool. Very calm. Excellent service. I got internet service free and that made my day!! overall good place to stay. we were little late for check-in but still we have not faced any difficulties. Even we got a great help from hotel staff. No language problem. I got international calling facility over there. however, it is not a preferred option as rates were too high. But something is always good then nothing.

Reviews.Title: “I met my husband there! its romantic!”
Reviews.Author: shan g
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing,,, of course its in the heart of Paris so how else could it be! so well structured and clean,,, very good price and great staff... hummm I loved it because the hotel has life long memories for me now.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A J
Reviews.Content: I made a standard room booking expecting four stars. What I got was no betterr than two stars: threadbare carpets, smelly, a very average old bed and a room that had some new touches but was clearly tired and poor quality. Despite being a hotel chain top member, the response and service was appalling. Floors one to three have not yet been renovated like the upper floors so be very wary of what you might end up with!! You may be paying less immediately next door at the Ibis hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Paris Montmarte”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in took almost 2 hours due to lack of staff. The trainee who was at the desk claimed that he does not know how to process check-in for bookings which are made via travel portal. Other than that undelightful long wait, everything else went smoothly. Rooms were nice and cosy - we took the Superior room instead of the Standard. Comes equipped with most amenities such as kettle, hair dryer, safe,etc. However, we were given a room that was facing the main street. As there was no air-cond, we had to open the windows and it can be quite noisy throughout the night. Highlights of the hotel would be the free unlimited wi-fi access! Also, there were plenty of restaurants, cafes and fast food around the area. Location is about 5 minutes away from the metro. Slightly going upwards, so lugging your bags from the Metro may not be ideal. Ibis Montmarte was just next to Mercure, and we were wondering if it was something that we should have considered for the price difference ... Moulin Rouge is just 5 minutes away but somehow our Moulin Rouge tour package already includes pick-up/return. Overall, it was quite pleasant, but that is the expectation for the slightly higher price that we are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “staff attitude needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: earlifransiska
Reviews.Content: rooms and all facilities are ok including the location as near by with the metro, and tourism spots, only thing is the receptionist attitude including the GM mr yousouf himself, we added 1 nite extra with the call from our room and it was confirmed, but the next day they asked us to pack up and check out, even a lady called and asked when would we leave. They had no regret on kicking us out. The hotel is fully booked, so I guess they are too confident their occupancy rate will always be high.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Montemarte Paris”
Reviews.Author: freles
Reviews.Content: Very central for Monte Marte Paris - but not anything like a 4 star hotel. Carpets were worn out and thread bear, however, the beds and bathroom were clean and reasonably comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Hoadswood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in November and was very impressed with all aspects. The front desk staff were very friendly, smiled a lot, and were extremely helpful. The room was ready, although I checked in at 11:00 pm, and it was a very nice room, a very comfortable bed, and a well-equipped bathroom, with an excellent shower. It's only a 5-10 min walk from Montparnasse station, which has excellent metro links, and TGV if you're travelling to the Atlantic coast of France. The area is full of bars and restaurants and feels very safe. If you walk back to the main road, cross it and walk pass the Pullman hotel, you come to a large roundabout, and on the right is an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower, which you could walk to in about 30 minutes. The hotel looked after my bag the next day while I went out, free of charge, in a locked room. The buffet breakfast is superb, with exceptionally nice bacon (not something you always get in France), so I was ready for the day ahead. A very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “ask for top floor”
Reviews.Author: rac4nd
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 4 nights. The hotel is 1/2 block from Metro so convenient for getting around Paris. Rooms are modern, perhaps recently redone. Upper floors look over surrounding buildings so have a good view of Paris. One wing sees Sacre Coeur well, the other views the Eiffel Tower. Good restaurants within 2 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: hampsteadhouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 5 friends on a 1 night stay at the end of October. The location of the hotel was great, a couple of minutes from a Metro station which allowed easy access to all the sights. The hotel had a lovely reception area and allowed us to leave our cases locked in a room on both days. We had 3 twin rooms which were clean and modern and the beds very comfortable. All in all, this hotel was perfect for our stay and at a great price via Hotwire.com. I would definitely recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We (wife and 6 yr. old) spent 5 days in Paris and the hotel was a good location to see the city. We asked for and were given a childs bed that worked well in the room. The room was not very special and the toilet was very small but it was on the whole, clean. The room is very well sound proofed, so sleeping was no problem. The breakfast is a little pricey and the food leaves something to be desired. There is no lack of bakeries in the area, so we ate fresh bagette each day with different lunch meats. There is a grocery just down from the hotel near the Moulin Rouge. The Underground connection is very convenient and we were able to connect the rest of the city very easily from the hotel. There is no parking at the hotel, we drove in from Germany. The parking garage costs 20 Euros per day so we had an extra 100 Euro cost for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Decent View of Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Ray T
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed our expectations. The rooms were updated and modern. The size was more than expected and breakfast was outstanding. We definitely plan to stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “NOT, for families.. Or couples.. But clean and OK”
Reviews.Author: Sonny_tmcf
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance, you have the moulan rouge , montmarte area, a cool old cemetery ... Unfortantaly also with walking distance, is hookers, the sex area, and the ghetto... Let's be honest a Europe ghetto is more of an eye sore than a danger, but none the less, avoid this hotel, unless you get a much lower than average price... It is clean, well staffed, and the metro is close buy as well... DONT eat there buffet or breakfast, it's not good, just go out for breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: rjperry61
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. Staff seemed even more friendly and helpful than last year. House keeping was exemplary. Great location! And the rooms are very quiet. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cybertyger
Reviews.Content: Did not have breakfast so can't comment on the quality of the food. Great location just round the corner from the Moulin Rouge and 15 mins walk to Sacre Coeur. Lots of bars & restaurants nearby & a great busy, bustling atmosphere. Comfortable beds - only complaint (being a bit picky) - air con not great so room slightly too warm & have had better shower although bathroom very clean. Overall a good hotel and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view from the room”
Reviews.Author: Sydneypoo Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you select the nineth floor rooms for which you may have to pay a little extra, you will be able to see either the sacre coeur or the Eiffel Tower from your room and the roofs of Paris. Very nice amenities in the room with free soft drinks and expresso when you book the executive rooms. book in advance and it will be less than 200 euros per night for a wonderful experience, combine it with a drink at la terrasse a block away and you will feel like you are on vacation for your Business trip

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CameronCalgary
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Paris, staying at the Mercure Paris Montmartre. We were very pleased with the accommodations. The hotel is in a great location and anywhere in Paris is quickly accessible on the Metro that is a block away. Other reviews we had read had commented negatively about the breakfast offered by the hotel. I don't know if they had changed it recently but the fresh breads and buns, cheeses and meats combined with fresh cut fruit, plus a selection of cereal if you wanted it were more than enough to keep me away from the small steam tray of scrambled eggs and bacon. I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For our perpose of visit this time,This hotel offer very convenient location and value for money accomodation.In addition to thoes, friendly Japanese speaking staff will help us time to time.We highly recommend this hotel and will stay again in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure a Parisian gem!”
Reviews.Author: ljrobertson
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Montmartre Mercure through a group package and were completely impressed during our stay. The rooms (implied through other comments on this site) are completely updated à la high-end boutique – clean, spacious and modern. The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful – often beyond the call of duty. They made long distance phone calls to our credit card company, let us into our rooms early, rebooked tours for us (twice) and provided every bit of advice required otherwise. The Montmartre location was ideal, as it was close to the Metro and the neighborhood itself is charming. It is an urban location and we experienced some early morning noise a couple of times when the bars spilled out, but generally it was quiet and safe. We were expecting the standard croissant and coffee breakfast and were pleasantly surprised by the additional fresh fruit, yogurt, (great French) cheese and cold and hot meat offered. We would stay here again in heartbeat and thank all of the staff for making our first visit to Paris wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: RedAhead
Reviews.Content: Given the great price we paid, we expected considerably less than we got. The hotel is clean and spacious. Our room (on the 4th floor) is newly remodeled and handsome. The bed is hard but not uncomfortable. The Internet is quite good. The room is quiet. Having done our homework before we came, we knew the neighborhood was a bit dodgy, and expected that. The quick subway ride into downtown makes that a minor annoyance. The nearby restaurants we've tried so far have been adequate, but not much more. I'm not especially impressed by any of them. The breakfast is unusual for a Paris hotel. It's obvious they cater to a lot of Brits and Americans, because it's far more robust than what Parisians usually eat. There's cheese and yogurt; a good selection of fresh fruit; bacon, sausage, and eggs; a choice of cereals; and an assortment of breads and croissants that were quite good. Our only complaint has to do with the service. The cleaning staff can't begin to keep up with the rate at which the tables turn over. As a result, the room always has either occupied tables or dirty tables, but no clean ones. This is a problem, because the table setup includes your utensils and coffee cup. If you can't find a clean table, you don't get either. We've taken to searching the dirty tables for unused cups and utensils so we can eat. (We've also resigned ourselves to pushing aside the dirty dishes so we can have a clear table to eat on. Once we sit down, the cleaners will not approach the table, so we're stuck with the pile of dirty dishes. Sooo appetizing.) The whole breakfast process is badly thought-out and badly managed, and needs to be reconsidered with an eye toward efficiency. Putting all cups, plates, and utensils on the buffet bar would be a strong start. Teaching the cleaners to work faster (there's room for improvement) would also help. Apart from that, it's on the high end of superior-class hotels. We feel like we got a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CMoss13
Reviews.Content: About twenty minutes by bus from the Eiffel Tower, this hotel is clean, modern, and reasonable, even though the rooms are a bit small by USA standards. There is no pool or gym, but one has Paris outside the front door. Area has good and inexpensive restaurants nearby for the budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Pictured”
Reviews.Author: yello815
Reviews.Content: Pluses: + Front desk was nice + Location is near Montmartre and Moulin Rouge and Metro Station + Plenty of Restaurants Nearby Negatives: - Rooms were dated and dirty (if you weren't fortunate enough to get one of the more updated rooms) - Beds were uncomfomfortable - Bathroom shower ceiling was held together by plastic beams. You could see the pipes while showering. - Stains on the wall and carpets - Expensive for the quality. More like a 2 star by American standards. You can get the LeMeridian or Concord by the Champs Elysses for the same price and both are of much better standard and better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, free softdrinks, free wifi - a good deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: BelleBamboozle
Reviews.Content: We had a Privilege Room that included free softdrinks and was bigger than the normal rooms. A very good choice. Very clean, modern design, comfy bed. Our room also had a view over Paris, but alas, we could only see the top half of the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast was nice, too. Nothing to complain about here. The Hotel is close to the lovely cafe area of Montmartre. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in lively location”
Reviews.Author: RamSox
Reviews.Content: I frequently use this hotel for when travelling to Paris on business. It's main strenght is its location as it is near the Place de Clichy metro station which enable me to get to the office or downtown Paris very easily. Near the hotel is the lively Place de Clichy area with bars, cafes and restaurants. Sure there are plenty of tourists, but there are plenty of locals too. The hotel is a short walk from the attractions like the Moulin Rouge and is a pleaseant walk through the streets of Montmartre up the hill to the Sacre Coeur. The hotel itself is modern with good sized rooms. The hotel is partly renovated. There is a small supplement for the renovated rooms. This is worth paying as the old rooms are tired. The desk staff are efficient, but sometimes there are long lines when tourists are checking in. As with all hotels in Paris the cost of your room will vary from good value to expensive depending on what events are taking place in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: mrstuna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a tour, and since we did not select the hotel, we didn't know what to expect. It was very fresh, new and ultra modern. It had all the amenities, and we were very comfortable. It was well located to metro and bus stops and near the small train to Montmarte. There were several good restaurants in the area. My only complaint is that the included breakfast was really bad. The scrambled eggs were powdered, and the worst I have ever had--inedible. (I have had motel eggs before that although not my first choice, were OK.) The fruit was canned fruit cocktail, the bacon was either burnt or underdone, and even the croissants were tough! The second morning there, we went out to eat. I would recommend the hotel with the caveat to stick to the yogurt and a hard roll for breakfast or go out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: romccaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in August. Really nice hotel. Stayed on the 8th floor in a room with a great view of Paris roof tops and Eiffel Tower in the distance. The hotel staff were really friendly, the room was really nicely (recently) decorated with everything we needed. The complimentary soft drinks were a really nice touch. Location was perfect, right by the Metro Station. My ONLY complaint: even though we had a "Do not Disturb" sign hung on the door, housekeeping would STILL come along and knock on the door. Even at 09:00am on a Sunday morning. Very infuriating when you want a lie - in. People complaining about the issue with the internet and "codes expiring". You don't even need a code to access the internet! Just input your name and email and you can log on any time. Read what's on the the screen!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Pilvi4444
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights there as part of a tour group from Canada. Excellent location, with easy walk to great restaurants, neighbourhoods, and Metro. Easy to find my way home, after late evenings in the museums. So close to Sacre Coeur. Clean & quiet room. Adequate breakfast, included. No complaints. Plan to bring my daughter in 2 years, because it was so well-located.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable hotel, not in the best area, but conveniently located and would recommend”
Reviews.Author: JohnTs58
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel clean, worth upgrading to a deluxe rooms which were more modern with better carpets. The rooms were a reasonable size with good bathrooms (shower and bath), tea and coffee and a minisafe. Outside the immediate area had ok shops and restaurants although it was close to the somewhat seedy sexshops area of Montmatre by the Moulin Rouge, handy for Place de Clichy metro and buses, with a service even to Charles de Gaulle airport. Gare du Nord was also not far and the shops at Opera within 10minutes walking distance. A better location would be the Champs Elysee area but its more expensive there. There is no dinner offered at the hotel and breakfast is expensive at Euros19, but there are several ok cafes within 100metres. It's necessary to go further away for a good restaurant for dinner, but we enjoyed doing that. The staff were efficient and friendly and the room service was good. Would recommend as a 4star hotel for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Otagopete
Reviews.Content: Great Location... handle to the Metro and Montmarte area.... I have stayed numerous hotel in the Mercure chain... and experience great services... This hotel was disappointing,., The front desk was average... check in and check out. The hotel was in the middle of building work.... The internet was patchy One of the 3 lift wasnt working... this saw queue and over crowded The prices is right and the location....

Reviews.Title: “OK but problems with internet”
Reviews.Author: jedrus7
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights, paying in advance for a room with a view. This is a typical huge hotel, with hundreds of rooms were the customer is completely anonymous. We got a room on the 9th floor with a nice view on the city. We had a third bed in the room, which we did not need, we ask it to be removed, but in vain. The big problem was wireless internet. It is served by Orange for 24 hours only, this means that you have to ask for new login and password every day, moreover, you have to login every time, if you switch on the computer. Couple of times it did not work, once I had to take my laptop to the reception, and they printed me the new login (there were some problems, they said) but they even did not bother to say sorry about that. Otherwise the place is OK if you like huge hotels without atmosphere. The location is very good, close to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “my choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticks most of the boxes for me in Paris: - Great location: well connected with the underground and easy to find. In a lively area with plenty of tourists but also with some hidden corners frequented by locals. - Nice rooms: clean, newly refurbished rooms, nicely decorated, with a good bed and coffe facilities. From some you can see the Montmartre hill, from other the Eifel tower. - Nice bathroom, big enough and with all what you need (although I am not a fan of separate toilet cubicles) - decent price/quality ratio: Paris is expensive, and I have tried other hotel in the are for the same price, but most are old and archaic Breakfast is ok, but they could be a bit faster replacing the hot food. FYI: the Ibis from the same company (Accor) shares the building with the Mercure, so all the location advantages, but I can not comment about it as I never stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and easy for the Metro”
Reviews.Author: ab2pcs
Reviews.Content: Close to Sacre Coeur,and the Moulin Rouge , with a 5 min walk to the Metro at Clichy.The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, the breakfast is good , and the staff were considerate and very helpful..the rooms are not huge but are comfortable. An easy walk to great cafes , bars and restaurants in Montmartre. If you just want a good place to have an easy dinner and some drinks, Clichy Tavern is very good , and inexpensive. . The Wepler is also nice, good seafood and less casual and of course more expensive. Both restaurants are about a 5 minute walk from the hotel . All round is very good for price and location .

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if someone else pays”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mercure is quite nice for a single traveler, particularly on business (I've done that). Rooms are similar to a standard Marriott in the US with a king bed, though don't expect quite the soft landing, as you may find the mattresses a bit more firm. For travelers with 3 or more (we were 4 this trip, 2 adults, 2 teens), hoping to share a room, this is not the place. A 2 bed option means 2 twin beds. And booking an extra room will price out about 50% above the Ibis right next door, also a part of the Accor hotels (But they won't tell you that at the Mercure) Location is pretty great, within walking distance to Sacre Coeur and depending on your motivation, to the Champs and beyond. My recommendatie on for the family or group - cyberrentals! We stayed in an apartment a couple years ago, on the left bank and close to all, for less than a hotel price. Bon chance!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you drive to Paris. Customer service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: texan75225
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for several reasons: 1) Driving into Paris through the "chunnel" I wanted to remain a bit outside of the city center and not be lost driving in a big city 2) Price point for the location- found a decent price including breakfast 3)Accessibility to the "Paris Flea Markets" and Metro station 4) Read the reviews on "Trip Advisor" and this looked like a good choice. Overall, this was a decent place to stay. GOOD things- it was easy to drive to hotel/locate the hotel. There is a large parking garage right next to the hotel (expensive but worth it.) Quick walk to the Metro station- easy to ride and never felt unsafe riding all over the city. Never had to hire a taxi. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable. Shower good and mini bar in room. Ice and vending machine not far. There is a small convenience/grocery store directly across the street from the hotel. Booked a rate through another website that included breakfast. Better rate than advertised by the hotel itself. Not the very best area of Paris but I never felt unsafe. Interesting, artsy area. One day we walked from the hotel to the Sacre Coure Cathedral - nice interesting walk and amazing view from the top of the church. BAD things-customer service is AWFUL. I asked for extra pillows and was told that I had to wait until the next day. When I told them that I specifically booked this chain/ a four star hotel in order to get things like EXTRA PILLOWS they decided to get a key to the maid's room and get my pillows. Simply ridiculous. One night the power was COMPLETELY OUT when my daughter and I returned to the hotel after dinner. Absolutely no lights/ no air conditioning. For some reason the elevators worked and we got out on our floor and made our way to the room. I used my cell phone in complete darkness as a flashlight to call the front desk. I asked about the power and was told that this had never happened before. I asked if there was a flashlight I could use and was told they would look and try to bring one. Never heard back. Not surprised. Again lousy, lousy customer service.Thank goodness it was not too hot to sleep. Sometime around 5:30 am the power went back on. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and decent but the breakfast room was like a cattle car. Much too crowded and not a nice ambiance at all. I would opt to forgo breakfast next time and get a croissant down the street. Overall: I would consider staying here again despite the sad customer service simply because of location and price point, place to park a car. If I return to Paris without a car, I will choose a different area of the city/ pay a little more for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: More than expected. location, service, value for money. Highly recommended for anyone. Added bonus is a garage underneath the hotel.Check in was fast despite a large group of Japanese tourist arriving at the same time. Booked a privileged room with free soft drinks, coffee and tea machine and panoramic view over Paris rooftops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Not What We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecure Paris Montmartre hotel for six nights with a tour group, meaning we did not have any choice of the hotel. If we were choosing the hotel we would probably pick a hotel more central to what we wanted to do in Paris. This hotel was very close to the Moulin Rouge/Pigalle and the Montmartre Area, but I we didn’t spend six days in these days. We used the Place de Clichy metro stop daily and we had no problems (pickpockets, etc.) whether it was 8am or 11pm. Around the hotel there were many restaurants (we only ate at one – Creperie Pen-ty – best crepes in Paris!), currency exchanges, and stores (allowing us to buy a pack of water and keep it in our mini-frig in the room). Our room was on the sixth floor and had a nice view over Paris. It was very modern with a large enough bathroom, a nice wardrobe area, a mini-frig, a safe, and a coffee/tea station. There were plenty of outlets to charge our cameras and cell phones, and the beds were very comfortable. On our first night at the hotel, the entire building lost electricity making it impossible to shower and get ready for bed. The Wi-Fi connection at the hotel was great (other than you needed to get a new access code everyday) and made it possible to keep it touch with friends and family back home. The worst part of the hotel was the breakfast. Because we were with a tour group for breakfast we were placed in a “special” tour group breakfast with other tour groups (sometimes a total of 4 or 5 groups were in a little breakfast room). The breakfast food was generally non-existent, over-cooked, or under-cooked. All of the people in our group felt the same way, and by the last three nights we went to a few boulangeries and patisseries, bought orange juice at one of the nearby stores and ate breakfast in our room. Overall the hotel was good, with breakfast being the only bad thing. Nothing was horrible about this hotel but we would most likely not stay at this hotel again. It wasn’t in the area we wanted and something about the hotel did not make it feel “Parisian.”

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Kayes
Reviews.Content: Apart from one very small gripe (shower had a bit of leak), this was pretty much perfect and we enjoyed our stay very much. The room (privilege) was well designed and the bed very comfortable. The staff were all very helpful too! Given that this hotel appeared to be be a bit cheaper than most four star hotels,(presumably due to its proximity to the very centre), I think it was good value for money. Saying that, the centre of town was still easily walkable and transport connections (metro or open tour bus) were good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location. We would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: bazzac11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Mercure Monmarte. The superior room was fantastic, very clean, modern and with it's own coffee machine which was very nice each morning. Our room was on the 8th floor and we got a view of the Eiffel tower from our window. The only thing we would say is that, as other reviewers have indicated, it is extremely important to get a room in the newer renovated part of the hotel, not a "standard" room which are the non-renovated rooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful too. As for location, it's just 5 minutes walk from Moulin Rouge and then a bit further along and up the hill is the Sacre Coeur. There is a metro station only a few minutes walk from the hotel and from there we were able to zip around Paris for all our sightseeing. There are bars and restaurants in the area which were more reasonably priced than other areas of Paris. We particularly enjoyed the food and service at the Tableau Pizza restaurant at Place de Clichy. Overall the hotel is in a good location to base yourself for a stay in Paris and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recent visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very well trained and helpful, the hotel was very clean and the facilities in the room ideal for a business traveller. Importantly WiFi was easy to access and free, another essential for the business traveller. The hotel was close to where I needed to be so a bonus. Excellent bar and well informed barman. The welcome drink was really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with excellent rooms and view from the ninth floor, definitely worth the extra money for the king size room!! Staff were both friendly and had good knowledge of the surrounding areas, the proximity to the metro and all the Parisian attractions was an added bonus. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “False guarantee”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with a guarantee that I would have a view over the roofs of Paris. For this I paid 50% extra. I got a view into a parking House just across the street. I had to stand just at the vindow to see anything but this ugly parking house.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: NicolesTravels
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and was allowed to check in before noon, which was great after an overnight flight. Staff was very welcoming and informed us that our room was being upgraded since our travel agent had called ahead and made a special request. Lucky us! Room 844 is one of the newly renovated rooms with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Beds are extremely comfortable with thick duvets and crisp cotton sheets. Hotel is very quiet, rooms have very thick curtains (it does not get dark here until after 11 p.m.! = good night's sleep every night. We could control our own AC, which is a bonus for having just the right temperature. Buffet Breakfast was offered with our package: some hot items that did not look very appealing and according to my husband did not taste very good, but a variety of cereals, yogurts, fruit, cheeses, deli meats, jams and rolls that were all very good were offered in a clean space on the 1st floor. Hotel is a couple minutes away from the Place de Clichy Metro and a BNP Paribas bank teller. Close to rue Lepic that has fruit markets, wine shops, bakeries, etc for a great picnic when you are too tired to go out for dinner. All in all, a great experience. Would not change a thing. If you are looking for a comfortable, affordable, safe, clean hotel, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Montmarte”
Reviews.Author: HueyPerth_Australia Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just spent the 2 nights in Paris at Mercure Montmarte, and absolutely no complaints. The room was huge and very clean/well presented. Staff friendly and accommodated my complete lack of French. Montmarte itself is located close to Paris' Red Light District. I wasn't phased by this, but if you are a bit of a wowser, then maybe this end of Paris isn't for you. Very close to the famous Moulin Rouge. Hotel is located very close to a Metro (Underground) station, which is all you need to get around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Madforsalsa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights in a "superior" room on the 7th floor, from which the Eiffel Tower was visible in the distance. Our room rate included the buffet breakfast. The room was very clean, sufficiently spacious for two people and modern looking (it must have been one of the renovated rooms). The staff at the hotel were friendly. The buffet breakfast was very good, although I would not go so far as to call it excellent (I have had better). The hotel's location is very good, despite being some distance away from city center. Not only is the Montmartre area itself worth spending time in - choose quaint, touristy or raunchy, depending on which direction you walk - but you are only a few minutes from a Metro station. Besides walking, the Metro is the only practical way to travel in Paris for most visitors. Get a free Metro map, buy a carnet of tickets to save a few Euros, taking care not to demagnetize them (store them away from electronics and metal objects), guard your wallet/purse from pick-pockets and you're good to go. The one downside for us of the hotel's location was the apparent lack of decent restaurants in the area. The few we hit were disappointing, at any rate. Perhaps we just chose poorly. But with a Metro station so close you've got the whole of Paris to choose from in that regard, not to mention numerous shops nearby selling excellent meats, sandwiches and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views and Value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved our room in this hotel. It was great value for the money. We stayed on the top floor in the premium room. We would do it again without a doubt. The views were great, the room was very large for a Paris hotel and we liked the free Wi-Fi and free drinks from the fridge. The wine at the bar was excellent and very reasonably priced. The staff were courteous and helpful. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that I made a request for a particular room 4 months in advance, I was told that it wasn't possible, and there was a merely a Gallic shrug in compensation. When I advised that I was a gold card member of the A-Club, so stayed frequently in Accor hotels, it also brought about the "sorry there is nothing we can do" comment. The room was ok at best for the price and not good value. I won't be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected! Enjoy it and will definitely back..”
Reviews.Author: Climb_and_Dive
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Europe, and luckily I pick this hotel. Read some negative comments, but my own personal experience is total satifaction. I was staying during Jun 9 to Jun 17, arrived early (9 am) and the reception was happy to help me with the check-in, store my luggage, give me an upgrade. The room is clean, I got a view of the Eiffel Tower, room is big and all facilities are new. (apparantly they renovated in 2009). The hot buffet breakfast is more than what I can expected with such a wide selection, the front desk is always helpful, their English is good., and a simple "S'il vous plait, excusez-moi" to start the conversation will help you a long way. The hotel located right at the centre of Montmatre, Metro is only 2 mins. away. Lots of restaurants around. Moulin Rough is 5 mins. walk. Sacre Coeur is only 20 mins walk away with the beautiful view of Paris, a MUST to visit. All other attractions are just few stops away. I enjoy my stay, a word of caution, I encoutered 4 occasions of pickpockets in the metro, one actually targeted me, 4 little girls just surround me and rob me, luckily I was alerted and other good Parisian help me to get away. So be VERY ALERT when travelling in the Metro. Otherwise, Paris is such a beautiful city... Enjoy. A last word to all the Hotel staffs ... a BIG THANK YOU to you all for making my trip such a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Clichy review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location - hotel mid-range but good area. Breakfast reasonable but be down early to avoid the wildebeest! Lack of a restaurant detracts but plenty in the area - particularly if you go off the beaten track

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamgoneagain
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was clean and comfortable. I had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower from my bed by the window. The bathroom was modern and bright. Each morning we had fantastic breakfast that left us full til dinner. We couldn't say enough about their breakfast buffet. From the coffee to the cheese to the pastries and yogurts and cold cuts it was all delicious and enjoyed in the pleasant company of other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value via Transat package”
Reviews.Author: arthur43
Reviews.Content: Excellent-quality buffet breakfast with lots of choice in a very pleasant room. A huge aid to keeping total meal costs under control. Occasionally, they ran out of cutlery or dishes but staff always responded politely and quickly. Our renovated room on the fifth floor was first-rate. From our window facing the street, one morning we saw two large men dressed all in white, one wielding a big leather strap, chase another man up the street. A drug incident? However, I hasten to add we never felt unsafe walking in the neighbourhood. The beggar permanently beside the sidewalk a few feet from the front door of the hotel never looked at or spoke to us or other passers-by. But his begging cup was placed directly in line with feet passing along his side of the sidewalk (so people had to step around it). Discreet but in-your-face at the same time. Clever! Nonetheless, we simply accepted him as part of the local colour. Another beggar outside the upscale Lafayette department store had a dog and cat with her, each with more than one bowl of food set out right there on the sidewalk. In France, everyone knows how to live well!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, rooms & location-parfait!!”
Reviews.Author: Shoegal1990
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a large group for one night, we chose this hotel due to it's proximity to the moulin rouge which we were visiting that night. Hotel service was excellent, the guy on reception was really friendly and helpful and booked us a reservation at a wonderful little brasserie round the corner. Very convenient for our short stay ! Rooms were modern and spotlessly clean, our room had a wonderful view over Paris and the sacre cleur! The man who worked on reception on the night time was also very helpful, deserves a mention ! All in all a great stay , 50 yards from the tube station so all of Paris within easy reach ! Excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: psghai2
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its surroundings, With Sacre coeur, Moulin Rouge the main attractions both at walking distances. Its just a 20 minute walk uphill to the Sacre Coeur passing through the most beautiful village and you get to see all types of painters doing what they do best. The rent is OK, it being Paris. The Rooms are generally clean and they have added some new levels which have more clean and better rooms. They have also now got a common ironing room on one of the levels where they have installed a ironing board and Iron in the corner small room and it helps if you have a shirt to iron for your early morning meeting. The breakfast is typically french, not many choices but OK. There is one added advantage for me as an Indian, very close by there on the way towards the Moulin Rouge, is an Indian Restaurant and also some middle eastern restaurants which serve a decent meal.

Reviews.Title: “It's all right”
Reviews.Author: RLMCT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located by the Place de Cluny in Montmartre. It is well located in terms of being close to the Metro station. It is only a couple of blocks from the Moulin Rouge and a short walk to Sacré Coeur and the artisan area. The hotel is booked by a lot of tours. It provides a full breakfast which has lots of variety and is good. The rooms are in need of refurbishment. The carpets are stained and tired. It is clean but the use of themed reproduction artwork by floor for famous artists are lame.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: KARW40
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own with my dog for one night. I would return there, simply because it was very reasonable for the location and quality of the hotel. My only negative on it was that I had very loud people in the room next door, who I could hear very well when they came in late at night. However, the overall experience and accessibility to public transportation and the interesting surrounding area made up for that one negative point.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best bit was the opportunity of early booking to obtain the best rate. Hotel is reasonably new and therefore smart and clean. Decor is subtle and apt. Plenty of nearby restaurants. Close to Metro 13. Would recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: Czech_George
Reviews.Content: Really good location - Montmartre, close to Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge and just few minutes from Metro station Blanche. For Paris very clean and surprisingly spacious room. Value for money - OK - not cheap, but, again - for Paris it is OK. Typically quite slow and lazy french staff (specially breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Mercure Montmarte.”
Reviews.Author: athena_anton
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from the Mercure Montmarte we stayed there from May 17th to the 25th. We were in a Superior Room 739 with a good view over the roof tops of Montmarte to the Eiffel tower. The breakfast buffet was great every morning no complaints there. I think what really made this hotel was the staff, always accomidating when asked for directions and any other inquires. Shout out to Kahl at the front desk he was a great help with everything. All and all this was a wonderful first trip to Paris and the Mercure Montmarte and we will be going back very very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Concrete_City
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent, minutes from Clichy metro, short walk to the Sacre Coeur and the surrounding area with its lively cafes, bars etc, a street away from Pigalle and the Moulin Rouge. When we arrived to check in the room we'd reserved wasn't available so the desk staff upgraded us to one of the "Privilege" rooms, which was a much appreciated gesture! The room was very comfortable, spacious, very clean and had everything we needed. The desk staff were always friendly and very helpful even when our french was very shaky, and on the last day we realised we'd left something in the room and they let us pop back up to check, no problems at all, very helpful and amenable. We didn't use the restaurant so can't comment, but it was a very comfortable stay. The room was quiet and the windows shut out all the noise from the busy street below, beautiful view of the Sacre Coeur, though the window was a bit on the small side. All in all we had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Deception!”
Reviews.Author: LeonorLopes
Reviews.Content: The photos on display to show us how the hotel is don't correspond to the truth. I stayed in a room that it was old, the carpet used to be green now is brown, so dirty it is. Next to my room a tray (whith the remais of a meal ) of another room stayed outside the room, on the floor for almost an entire day .The staff wants to help but most of them are not prepared. If you asked to some of them anything about Paris they simply don't know. If you have a problem and ask for help as i did they just simply don't care. On the day i left the transfer to the airport forget to pick me up i asked for help (on the 25 of April 2011) the man in charge on the reception just said to me that,'s your problem. A girl that was the reception understood the situation and gave me directions for a Cab. This is not a four star Hotel and they don't the staff to go whit it. My name is Leonor Lopes and i'm from Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend break”
Reviews.Author: DougPiranha Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris to 4 days to do the tourist stuff. Location is brilliant. Easy access to everything/everywhere. Few minutes walk from 'Place de Clichy' metro and the Open Top Tour bus stop. Very clean and tidy hotel. Staff were always polite and helpful. Had the privilege room. Good size and nice view of Paris. Two small points: Wish the windows could open more than the few inches they did, as would of been nice to be able to take photo of views and to be able to properly look out.. Also, and not too important; If you want to watch a bit of TV inbetween being out and about, the only channel in English is BBC World News. Other languages catered for with a bit of entertainment - But not really there to watch TV. Did not eat or drink here, so cannot comment. Plenty of options around the area. Would definately go back again. Minus point for communication: I sent e-mail to hotel on the 4th with question and did not receive a reply until the 8th.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience.”
Reviews.Author: TDas1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was neat and clean. The lobby was large and very nice. The dinning hall was neat and clean as well. The staff was very cordial. The room was spacious and the toilet was very very clean. The complementary breakfast was very good . Overall it was a very very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GATOZ
Reviews.Content: We were at Mercure with my family for 3 nights, 24/3-27/3. They offered to us 2 adjacent rooms, both having great views το the Monmartre hill. The paper work was minimal. Both rooms were very clean and well decorated. With the windows closed the silence is fantastic and the same goes to the internal noise insulation: I could not even hear the family teenagers arguing... The stuff was very helpful, even if some of them do not speak English, they try hard to help you. The location is great for a group visit, there is a bus parking just outside the hotel. In advance, next to the hotel someone can find a lot of convenience stores, super markets, cafes and restaurants. I understand that close to the hotel is a red district area, but it was very safe to walk, at least I felt no danger for me and my family walking there after 23:00! Also the best walk is to go at the opposite side where you can hear and smell the ‘normal’ people living place not just the attractions! The breakfast is good, even if the selections are limited, and well cooked. Wi-fi is free but I believe to use an A4 paper for every 24hours is not eco-friendly. What I only suggest to the hotel management team is to offer slippers! In conclusion, as a regular traveler for business and leisure, I find this hotel to be very good and maybe deserves another star in contrast with many 5* and 4* hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: RonKosh
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel room from booking.com. I was a bit leery since it was near Pigalle but it turned out to be a great hotel at a great price. Excellent shopping and restaurants nearby and the metro will whisk you away to all the tourist spots. I wandered around the hotel during the early morning and late evenings to buy bread, crepes, etc. The metro is within a few minutes. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was excellent and comfortable. I love Paris but I love Paris even more when I am this comfortable and at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Well-placed and priced for a young couple to see the sights of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LadyTeacake
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent three nights in this hotel at the beginning of March 2011. We travelled by RER and then metro from CDG airport, changing at Gare du Nord/La Chapelle. The hotel can be viewed immediately from leaving the Place de Clichy metro station. We were checked in quickly and our room was ready when arrived at around 5pm. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room as we knew that hotel rooms could be small in Paris. The bathroom also had a good-sized bath. The beds were comfortable and there was enough storage for a stay of three nights. The bathroom came equipped with a hairdyer and toiletries. Our room was at the front of the hotel and the window looked onto the busy road however when the windows were closed we could hear hardly any noise. The hotel is quiet in the evenings and we had great sleeps. The hotel is at the bottom of the Montmartre hill and just off the Blvd de Clichy. The Pigalle red-light district is not far away and while this part of the street is undoubtedly seedy, it feels perfectly safe. A walk up the hill leads you to Montmartre with good shops and restuarants and of course, the Sacre Coeur. Opera and the Arc de Trimuphe are also in walking distance and the Place de Clichy metro station is well connected with sights across the city. This station feels safe in the evening. Overall, the hotel offered very good value for money through a hotels.com deal and we got a much larger and nicer room in Paris than we expected on our budget - even if this budget would have got us signifcantly more in any other city. But the beauty of Paris is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “everything i expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: shoeslut
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day visit to Paris and was REALLY pleased with the hotel. Having travelled extensively in Paris i was unsure at first about the location (most of the "sights" are a metro ride away) although Montmartre has a charm of its own which i only really discovered walking around on the last day. The Place de Clichy/Moulin Rouge/bar neighbourhood is a little sleazy, but if you veer away from that to Montmartre and the Sacré Coeur and you discover a whole new village atmosphere. Also i was a little concerned that the Mercure brand would mean the hotel was devoid of individual character. However, i was delighted with the choice. It is well worth paying a bit extra for the top floor privilege rooms which offer a simply stunning view over the rooftops of Paris and gives a few pleasing extras like espresso machine, complimentary soft drinks in fridge, bathrobes and late check-out as part of the 3 night package. I never got up in time to sample the inclusive breakfast (it was a relaxing weekend away after all!), but the service from Bruno at the bar every night was excellent! Overall, superb value for money in a city where hotel rates are certainly at a premium.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the brand name and also think of it is a French hotel group so I thought I should try it out. Unfortunately it is a totally disappointed experience. First I had my booking through email with the reservation department. It took few days for the reservation department to reply my email and after the quotation of the current package. It took another few days for them to reply me with the bad new of fully book. Luckily at the end I managed to make the reservation through internet. The nightmare began when I check in the hotel. I had reserved 2 rooms for 4 days. 1 twin bed room and 1 king size bed room. However during the check-in, the staff informed me I reserved the twin bed room only and when I show her my confirmation, she just simply suggest me come back tomorrow for room change. I also work in the hotel industry and we also experience fully book. But when we see the reservation like this (1 king bed and 1 twin bed), we will believe it is a family booking and will not change the king size bed to twin bed room!! Breakfast did not have much choice and the food was not refill after finish. I totally regret I should use the money to have my breakfast outside! One day I was going to the front office to ask for late check out. Firstly, it was a mess in the lobby, nobody line up and people just rush to the counter once it was empty. I saw the front office manager was helping in the counter but he didn't try to organize and control the lobby crowd. At the end, I was able to be served by one of the front office staff. I told him I would like to have a late check out for tomorrow and he did not seem to know what is a late check out!!! After explaining him the situation he said he will leave a message. So the next day I went to the front office to confirm my late check out, the staff said he did not receive any information and he rudely said "it is not my problem. You told the guy from yesterday and now it is me working"! I was totally shocked with his attitude and disappointed with the communication of the front office team! During check out, I gave my Accor membership card to the staff and he said the system can not recognize the card (which it works perfectly during my stay in Mercure in Zurich). Then I told him my airline membership number. The staff insisted that he can only enter it to the system when he see the card. Moreover i think the internet voucher is very not environmental friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor decor”
Reviews.Author: m0ec
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Montmartre and is 50m away from the metro and bus stops. It is very convenient to get to the Eurostar train station, the Eiffel tower, or any other sights in Paris. Also, the area is lively and buzzing with activity and the hotel has friendly and helpful staff. The hotel itself is very dated. The foyer is old and our room was very old. Some of the pictures posted on this site show better rooms so it is possible that we did not have a revamped room.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Extension”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was satisfactory over all but we both disliked the breakfast service and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Week-end escape”
Reviews.Author: AndrewPBarnstaple Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a good location, convenient for the metro into the city and Gare de Nore for the train back to CDG airport. We booked the priveledge room which was a little expensive but offered great views over the city and the Sacre Coeur and so it was worth it. Didn't eat breakfast as 18 Euros seemed excessive.Staff were helpful and the hotel very clean. Overall it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “i could get sick with that hairdryer”
Reviews.Author: george189413
Reviews.Content: very clean but they gave us 2 single beds.we've asked king size.Breakfast was poor and the staff unfriendly..but this is their nature i guess

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Issy63
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, staff very friendly and helpful. Room recently refurbished and spacious. would def recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: RJohnstone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting in December. Check in was a very smooth affair, quick and courteous, with very good English spoken by the young lady at reception (which was a positive, as my French is not good!). My room was immaculate, beautifully presented, modern and comfortable. The bed was large and very comfortable. The TV had the usual selection of local channels, with some European channels too. The bathroom was modern and again immaculate, with a great shower with good water pressure (very important in any hotel - you can't beat a great shower!) One slight moan about the room was that the air conditioning seemed largely inneffectual. Any movement on the control seemed to do very little and as a consequence, the room was quite hot throughout my stay. Nothing to get too worked up about though. The floor was quiet (5th floor) with very little noise from either the corridors or adjoining rooms - aiding a very good sleep. Breakfast was a buffet type affair, with a great selection of cold and cooked meats, fresh bread, coffee, tea and fruit juices. Also a good selection of yoghurts, pro-biotics and fresh fruit / cereal. We didn't eat our evening meal in the hotel, but there are very good restaurants within the local vicinity and the hotel is exceptionally close to the Place de Clichy metro stop, putting you litterally minutes away from some great restaurants (a 10 minute 1.50euro trip on the metro and we were at the Champs Elysees). The hotel is well located for ease of transport about central Paris. Yes, it's close to the red light district, but there were absolutely no problems either outside or directly around the hotel. Don't let this put you off staying here - one of the major attractions of Paris (the Moulin Rouge) is a 5 minute walk away, so don't be put off. A very pleasant and comfortable stay - wouldn't hesitate in recommending or staying here again for business or pleasure. One comment would be the constant hub-bub in reception - because there is a large proportion of tourists here, there are always coaches outside and lots of groups of tourists in reception - but this is expected for any hotel on the tourist trail. Again, this shouldn't put you off. Good hotel, quiet, professional service at every turn and a very enjoyable stay on the whole.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay. Cleaned, quiet, location, everything is WELL”
Reviews.Author: Frany3544
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong to say !! welcoming staff, beautiful and extra cleaned room, NO NOISE, very good breakfast... A parking lot (not free) at next door. Everythings was perfect.
