Reviews.Title: “Ideal location but rather seedy locality.”
Reviews.Author: Canoldir
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Montmartre is a great place to stay if you want a superior quality hotel near to Montmartre and it is ideally situated for the Metro system and easy access to the main tourist centres. Our room was on the top floor with a great view over the city. It was always clean and very well prepared for our return in the afternoon. The toilet was rather small but the bathroom and shower were excellent and the beds very comfortable. The only criticism we had of the room was the poor quality small coffee percolator which seemed to have replaced the much more useful kettle and sachets of coffee / tea on previous visits. Mercure should get rid of these percolators in our opinion as they appear cheap and inefficient - the coffee produced was only in small quantities and the machine was temperamental. Having said that, this was our only gripe. Breakfast was not too crowded, the service was excellent and the choice was very good. We thought it was rather expensive nevertheless at 17 euros each. We would certainly return to the Mercure Montmartre in the future as it has everything you need from a Paris hotel. There is no restaurant but you can go 100 metres down the road to the Brasserie Wepler. Our meal here was one of the highlights of our visit. The service and ambience was outstanding and the food excellent. We would also steer clear of the Boulevard de Clichy near the Moulin Rouge as every other place along here appears to be a sex shop. Some may find this amusing - we found it to be seedy and rather a blot on the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent facilities - get the carpets changed”
Reviews.Author: ramseyiom
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Paris for a long weekend. The hotel could not have been in a better location, minutes from Sacre Coeur, Montmartre and the Moulin Rouge. Plenty of cafes and bars in the area. Quite expensive so look for the happy hours and plat de jours to help keep the costs reasonable. The hotel was excellent except for a couple of minor problems. The air conditioning kept the room very warm even at the lowest setting and the overall refurb has not got to the carpets yet. On the 3rd floor these were grubby and dirty and gave a bad first impression. This was soon overcome by the overall excellent facilities. Breaffasts were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location, Great service, not so good shower...”
Reviews.Author: morinev
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mercure Montmartre Paris for 3 nights. The room was great and a great size. Very clean, nice little fridge... The only thing I would say to be careful is the shower. I guess I got a "disabled" room which is not a problem for me however, there was no shower door or curtain so water got everywhere in the bathroom which was not really great when you want to go back in the bathroom to brush your teeth or anything else. One other thing which is fine but was a little annoying. I stayed from 11nov-14nov which is 3 nights. I had to argue with the agent at the desk when I checked out that I stayed with 3 nights and he was saying 4 nights!!! My husband even got involved. He was really believing himself that we stayed for 4 nights when from 11-14 is really 3 nights!! Also we got 4 breakfast charged to us when we never ate at the hotel. Small thing but when you have the stress to leave from hotel to get to the airport, it would be nice to checkout nicely. Other than that, the hotel was great. Great location which is about 5 minute walk from Mouline Rouge, nice walk to Galerie Lafayette as well and very close to the "Open Tour" bus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room size for Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevieWebbs
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Mercure Montmarte, before moving to a hotel on the Left bank. In hindsight, we wished that we had stayed the full 2 weeks + at Mercure Montmarte. Accessability to all areas in and around Paris was fantastic from this hotel location. The staff spoke excellent English, and were always more willing to assist in planning to visit places of interest. Our room (recently renovated) was large with comfrotable kingsized bed, wonderful.nights sleep each night. The breakfest which was included in our hotel package was awesome each day...I highly recommend this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One thing spoiled our stay...”
Reviews.Author: cutie300
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel! The location was amazing, and our room was very clean and modern. The night before we left however, my hubby asked the concierge about booking a taxi for the next morning to the airport, as our flight was at 1:30pm. They advised us to leave the hotel at 9:30am, and that they would arrange for our taxi so that we wouldn't have to worry. When we came down the next morning however, there was a line up of people sitting around in the foyer waiting for taxis. When my hubby asked the concierge about the one that was 'supposedly' booked for us, the girl phoned the taxi company to see if our taxi was ever ordered and it wasn't. Then we were told to wait another 20 minutes for a taxi. In the meantime, my hubby went out for a smoke and he was able to hail down a taxi to take us to the airport. When he came back into the hotel to let me know, the guy behind the desk told us that there were others in line waiting for a taxi, and that we need to wait for our turn - even though my hubby had flagged down the taxi himself. While we lugged our bags outside, the concierge had sent the next customer waiting in line for the taxi outside to talk our driver out of taking us to the airport and to take him since he was next in line. I was so happy when our taxi driver said no, that we were the ones who had flagged him down. I've stayed at other hotels where there would be someone from the hotel standing outside flagging down taxis and making sure that everyone was on their way. This last bit definitely left a sour taste in my mouth after such a pleasant stay at the hotel. I would still recommend this hotel, but would strongly advise not to entirely depend on their concierge services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: sun5hine56
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group. Cute place and personnel very nice and helpful. Close to metro and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sd508
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience with this hotel. Located in Montmartre, it is 5 minutes walk to Moulin Rouge, and has a great selection of restaurants and amenities open late. Would definitely recommend. Hotel was super clean and room was great. Staff were also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: SuS001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2010. On the positive side the location of the hotel was fantastic and the rooms (of which we stayed in two) were very well decorated and clean. Unfortunately the service and management at the hotel negates all this. On arrival we were told that the room we had booked for three nights was only available for the last two nights and the first night we would have to stay in another room, moving on the second day. Firstly when staying only three days in a hotel I do not appreciate having to repack and move all my belongings one day into the stay. And secondly if for whatever reason the hotel did not have the room I had reserved available then I would have appreciated being informed of this prior to my arrival at the hotel. Having finally moved to the room we had booked we found that the air conditioning was not working. It was unbearably hot in the room. Despite both myself and my partner phoning and going down to reception multiple times we were not given a satisfactory answer as to why we had no air con. Different members of staff gave us different reasons, some saying it was a problem throughout the hotel - however as soon as we stepped outside the door of our room it was perfectly cool in the hallways. Every time we asked we were told that someone was working on it. So you may ask why we didnt call the 'direct line' to management that the manager seems so keen to mention? Countless times we called this number and noone picked up. We raised all these concerns throughtout our stay an again on check out and advised the staff that we would be posting this review. They did not seem bothered. One of my reasons for choosing this hotel was that the management seemed to actively respond to customer's reviews on tripadvisor. Little did I realise that management response after your stay has little benefit when you are trying to get someone to address your concerns during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: qfaust
Reviews.Content: I would not trust the staff of this hotel. I booked 2 renovated rooms on the upper floors. When I checked in I found that one of the rooms allocated to me was a disabled room. That is not a problem in itself. The real problems started when we returned from dinner and decided to shower. There is no shower screen in the bathroom (to enable wheelchair access), and the water flooded all over the bathroom floor. It was impossible to contain the water only to the shower area. Without any other floor drains the water could not possibly drain away and puddled about 13mm or half an inch all around the toilet and the hand basin. During the early hours when I visited the bathroom I found myself wading through the water (where's the wellies I thought?) When I climbed back in bed I found that the bottom of my pyjamas were soaked from the puddles. The next morning when I compained to the front desk staff I was told that if I waited around the hotel till noon then I could change rooms. When I told them that we would be out sightseeing at tht time and was there any other alternative. I was told that they would send up someone to mop the floors whenever I asked, so I said that I would therefore stay in the room.......what a mistake. After returning late to the hotel and showering we had the same problem. Called the front desk to get the floor mopped and was told that no-one would be able to come to the room to mop the floor. It was only about 9.30pm. There was no satisfaction given, nor any follow-up from management. I also dislike the attitude of hotel staff who deny the existance of any problems in a room when you can tell that the problem has been there for ages. In this case I photographed the bathroom floor to show the permanent water stains on the black floor tiles to prove this was not the first time that the room had flooded. Added to all that was the fact that we were charged for 4 breakfasts that we didn't have, and had to waste time correcting their mistakes when trying to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel we've stayed at in paris”
Reviews.Author: hilcrossEssex
Reviews.Content: this was our fourth visit to paris and by far the best hotel staff were pleasant and helpful especially friendly bar staff rooms were pleasant and quite large by paris standards we had a room on the 3rd floor breakfast was excellent with good choice of hot and cold food a good central position with easy access to metro and buses we used the open top bus tour which had 50 stops and four routes had an excellent meal in the japanese restaurant opposite the hotel would recommend this hotel and will certainly stay here again on our next visit to paris

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: CityVisitor01
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative to say about this hotel. Loved the location - really close to the lovely Montmartre, almost on top of the intriguing cemetary, possible to walk to the very heart of Paris yet away from the hoards of tourists and if you use the Metro just 2 minutes away from the station. Facilities really good standard - with some nice touches, free laptop safe and ample sized fridge being two of them. Our breakfast in bed was really nice. Whilst this hotel lacks the initmacy of some more bijou places it was not at all too 'corporate' and was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should visit Paris at least once in their life.”
Reviews.Author: PamJMP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, as a birthday treat for a special birthday. It had been 50 years since we last visited Paris, so a sentimental return. The Mercure is conveniently situated at the foot of La Butte, the hill on which Sacre Coeur stands and we could see the basilica from the window of our room. The rooms are quiet, even though we faced a busy road (roadworks at the time of our stay, improving the layout at Place de Clichy). An unexpected find for the Continent was tea/coffee making facility in the room. It is a hotel used by many tour groups for one night stays so can be busy in the mornings but regular guests have a separate dining area for breakfast. There is plenty of choice of cereals, bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs plus the usual continental cold meats and cheeses with a wide selection of bread, croissants etc. fruit juice, teas and coffee. Alongside the Cemetery of Montmartre (an interesting place to visit), it is near the Moulin Rouge (very expensive - cheapest dinner and show being 150 euros) and at the edge of Pigalle. It seemed a perfectly safe area from what we saw. The little 'train' is a good way of getting to know the layout of Montmartre. It leaves from Place Blanche and costs 6 euros per person, stopping at Sacre-Coeur where you can get out and return by a later 'train' . Metro tickets are valid on the buses - a carnet of 10 costs 12 euros. We found an interesting bistro at 'Au Virage Lepic' up the steep Rue Lepic. The food is excellent. There are many eateries all over Montmartre to cater for all tastes. The Mercure does not offer an evening menu and seemed to have the restaurant only for breakfast. In the city, the Batobus is a useful vehicle for stopping off on a river trip at points of interest along the Seine. We didn't use it so cannot quote the cost. It is a get on and off facility over about 8 places. As people over the age of 55, we were pleased to accept a 2 for 1 offer on the breakfast. That may be a special deal and not permanent, but it was a nice surprise when it came to settling the bill. We had a lovely visit and hope it won't be another 50 years before we return!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: jdVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newly-refurbished rooms in August 2009 on a girls-only trip. We were very impressed and were enticed back when the Accor hotel chain sent us a special web offer so we booked the hotel again for 6 nights in July 2010. As mentioned in the previous reviews, the refurbished rooms are very comfortable with nice bed linens (comfy duvets), flat screen TVs, and a convenient empty bar fridge that you can store your picnic items. Front desk service was always friendly and prompt. When I originally booked using the North American reservation line, the agent made an error and booked an incorrect date. When I emailed the hotel directly, they corrected the error immediately and responded to my email within 12 hours. The hotel now offers free WiFi in rooms but you have to pick up a daily code from the front desk. We did not have the breakfast buffet included this year as it was expensive at E17 per person, but enjoyed it last year as part of our Air Transat package. As for location, the Metro is very close by, Flunch (budget cafeteria-style restaurant) next door has great ice cream deals, Mono Prix and a good boulangerie are 1.5 blocks away, and Montmartre is a short stroll away. As with any hotel, good value depends on pricing. I would not book this hotel for the posted rack rate but found the web specials reasonable.and, in the case of the Accor web offer, an incredible deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: alstonx
Reviews.Content: We sstayed here with two teenagers for 3 nights during the first week of the summer holidays. We had booked two twin rooms which were described as "refurbished in 2009" and I would certainly recommend this as they were both very clean, modern and comfortable with very good showers. Air con could have been better but luckily it wasn't too hot. Having the window open was fine as we were on the ninth floor (we'd asked to be away from street noise). Breakfast was great, with anything you could possibly want available (hot items such as pancakes, bacon, sausages and scrambled egg as well as the normal selection of breads, croisants, cereals, cold meats, cheese, yogurts and even noodles!) The staff were very willing to accomodate any request. In fact all the staff were very friendly and helpful. Location wise it is quite easy to avoid the sleazy part of the area and the metro is literally a minute walk, with the more picturesque parts of Montmartre a short stroll away up the cobbled, leafy streets. We even walked to the fancy shops at Gallery Lafayette (about 25 mins) Highly recommended, but worth booking in advance with special requests - and go for the refurbished rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, standard room and good service”
Reviews.Author: stefi1970
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Montmartre has a convenient location, just a 15 min. walk from Montmartre Hill and 5 min. from a couple of Metro Stops which will take you to downtown Paris (Louvre, Champs Elysee`, etc.) in few minutes. The hotel is what you can expect from a Mercure: small lobby but nice persons at the front desk, dimly and smelling corridors but everything clean around. We got a room on the top floor which, in spite of the small window, has a great view over the Tour Eiffel (ask for a room on the back side when you check-in!) . The room was quite small but very well organized, with a big flat TV and a useful narrow table to put your stuff on. The closet was small, too, but has some useful shelves. Useful in-room amenities are: a water boiler to make coffee or tee, a small empty fridge (you can order from room service if you want or simply buy your stuff and keep it in the fridge for free) and a safe. The bed was extremely comfortable, with extra pillows and a fantastic soft duvet. Standard but clean bathroom. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but if you just step out you can find any kind of nice restaurant or brasserie open at any time. We had breakfast delivered in room (included in our rate) and it was very good - I liked in particular the freshly baked bread and croissant served in a paper bag and the complimentary newspaper. Overall, standard hotel but good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean, good value, and close to Metro station and Sacré Cœur”
Reviews.Author: teri_miss
Reviews.Content: It's Europe, so the room was small, but kept very clean and was nicely decorated. Our room faced the street, so even with the window closed and the blackout curtains drawn, we could hear noise on the street. That wasn't a problem for us, but might be for someone who goes to bed early and is a light sleeper. The restaurant serves breakfast only, but light snacks are available at the bar after 5 pm. There is also a limited room service menu. Prices in the bar were a bit steep, but typical for a hotel bar. My only complaints are 1) the bartender was often absent from the bar (had to search him out at the front desk a few times); 2) I sent some pants for cleaning and when I went to wear them the morning I left, they had not been cleaned but only pressed, so the stains were well set in by the heat of the iron (paid 10 euros for "cleaning" and pants are now in the trash); 3) wake-up call service worked sporadically -- sometimes right on time, sometimes 30 to 45 minutes late; and 4) service at breakfast was either excellent or quite poor. Overall, though, a good value with friendly and professional front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay when visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: steelman99
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. From the moment we arrived, we knew we had made a great choice. It was only an 8 euro cab ride from the Paris Nord train station which is a bargain in itself! Once you got past the construction outside, the hotel was awesome. From the large lobby to the friendly staff the first impression was great. Our room was very nice - modern decor with a great view of the Eifel Tower and the Paris skyline. A short wall to the Sacre Couer Cathedral and the small quaint shops and resaurants around it made for a great evening outing. The area of Montmartre has a lot to offer. We used the Metro to get around and found it to be very user friendly if you take the time to try it out. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend the Mecure Montmartre to any travellers planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value.great location.good service.”
Reviews.Author: yona29
Reviews.Content: Pros: We went on a 7 night trip to Paris, and when booking hotels, location was the most important factor. We were not disappointed. The metro station (Place de Clichy) was a minute away, so were coffee shops,restaurants and fast food shops. Convenience stores were 10 minutes away. The location is not sketchy at all(even though the Pigalle street is nearby which itself was pretty safe),and it was safe to walk around even at 2 am.Its quite a bussy area with all the cafes and bars around but we couldn't hear anything from our room. Took the advice of some other reviewers and requested a room on the high floors. we got a room on the 7th floor with an awesome view of the Eiffel Tower and its surroundings.The staff was pretty friendly and helpful and most spoke english.Breakfast had quite a variety of food (from croissants to fruits and cheese and yoghurt) and closed at 10am.The rooms were clean and small but still a doable size. They included the staples of any hotel room( coffee/tea maker,mini fridge,safe,blow dryer,nice flatscreen tv)Bathrooms were nice (but the shower only had half a glass door and a lot of water would escape,so make sure u dont slip when coming out). Our blow dryer was not working properly and the hotel had it fixed the next day.Toilet was in a separate room beside the bathroom. Cons: My mom found the mattress too hard and had some muscle pain but i thought they were ok. Internet was not free and kinda expensive it cost 10euros for 45min( to use the hotel computers)... especially for a student on a budget. The hallways smelled kinda stuffy but the rooms did not... Overall pretty good experience. Would definitely use the same hotel again =)

Reviews.Title: “terrible,disgusting and cheated”
Reviews.Author: HDassani
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a terrible let down the rooms size is ok but very bad interiors and though we asked for a no smoking room , the rooms had terrible odour , the staff - house keeping was very bad and rude the location of the hotel is fine but everything else is a terrible the breakfast was a let down the coffe machine not working the juice machine not working the staff not helpful please avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location but too loud and poor service on reception.”
Reviews.Author: Purple_Turtle_HH
Reviews.Content: First impression wasn´t good - it took half an hour to get checked in. We had booked a non-smoking room but we ended up with a smoking room. Apparently no other rooms available at the rate we´d booked and we´d have to pay extra for a non-smoking, higher standard room! We took the smoking room anyway as it was late in the evening and we were tired. The room (standard) was a good size. One of the beds was really creaky, though. But the worse problem was the lack of isolation. It probably didn´t help that we had really inconsiderate neighbours, who on the one side partied till late in the night and on the other side came back in the middle of night and put the TV on loud, which was really annoying as you could hear everything. The noise from the street was also very loud. I didn´t get one decent night´s sleep the whole time (3 nights) we were there. I didn´t find the room particularly clean, either. I found rubbish under the bed which we didn´t bring in with us. On a more positive note, the breakfast was very good with a wide selection on offer, even noodles for the asian guests. And the shower was nice and powerful. Even though it is in a great location just around the corner from the beautiful Montmartre area, I´m afraid I wouldn´t recommend this hotel for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Book this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mkennedy38
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Noise was a minimum. The breakfast was quite good. Check in and out was smooth and the staff spoke English quite well. I stayed in room 848 and loved it. I had a HUGE bed with comfortable linens. The lobby has wine tasting in the evenings. My room was kept well stocked a tidy. I had a view of the Eiffel Tower from my room. However there isn't free Wi-Fi avaliable. The Metro is just a short distance away. There are numerous shops and great restaurant in this area. Just a step to the left of the hotel is an old cemetery that has Jim Morrison’s grave. The hotel is within walking distance of Montmartre, the Moulin Rouge, and Sacre Coeur.

Reviews.Title: “Best value/price”
Reviews.Author: socrates64us
Reviews.Content: the hotel is only 3*, - but - if you pay € 10.- per night extra, you get one of the newly renovated rooms in the 7th or 8th floor - and a stunning view over the roofs of the neighbouring houses to Eiffel Tower and Dome des Invalides :-D. Be sure to ask the clerk at the front desk for it. All rooms ar quite spacy. The old rooms are regular 3* - the new rooms are high above 4* with indirect - and if you wish, romantic coloured - lightning, superb beds and cushions, a lot of mirrors, WiFi (Orange), Flat screen, own in-room Coffe Bar, very good frige w/ glass door - and the stunning view. There are Non smoking rooms - and, but only if you ask for it - smoking rooms avaliable. The location is ideal - right next to the montmatre cemetery at the lively Rue Caulancourt - next to Place Clichy Metro Station. The staff is corteous and helpfull, thou not all receptionists speak english. The Breakfast is large by variety and of good quality. You have your own espresso machine at the Buffet. Room Service is quick and utmost friendly. The rooms are very clean. All in all a real bargain!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “TOURISME”
Reviews.Author: marcovely
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very quiet ,the staff is looking for you.Hotel very good located in center of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Bon Service”
Reviews.Author: Cantravel4now
Reviews.Content: Granted the hotel is situated nearby a seedy district but all in all, the service was phenomenal. The manager did not hesitate to upgrade at no charge in a new remodelled room on the top floor with a fantastic view of the Tour d'Effiel. The advantage of this hotel is also that a grocery store is nearby. Making meals on the go very convenient. Further, the Metro is conveniently located. I have stayed twice at this hotel and would most definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, efficient but lacking charm and in a seedy area”
Reviews.Author: Eroslondon
Reviews.Content: The Mercure is part of the accor chain and shares the site with an Ibis hotel (a more budget focussed offering from the same group). The hotel has been recently refurbished. It is a business hotel, but I think they are trying to create a boutique feel with the common areas having a some Art Nouveau touches. I found the decor a little odd (dark olive walls and red highlights)but everything in the room worked well. Although the hotel is at a busy road junction the external soundproofing was very good, so I heard little outside noise. One bonus for me was that the blackout curtains were very effective, so it was possible to get the room nice and dark, which I always prefer. Some of the English signs were a bit baffling - I'm still not sure why I'd want to be "impregnated by the uncompleted paintings in the bar" ! The hotel is about a 10 euro taxi fare from Gare du Nord, where the Eurostars arrive. You can get here by metro but you need to change lines and the metro station stairs are awkward if you have heavy luggage. The main downside is the local area. The hotel is right on the edge of the Pigalle red light district, an area full of sleazy bars, fast food joints, tourist traps, lurid sex shops and touts. Having said that, it is easy walking distance to Montmartre and the Sacre Coer and transport links are good. Overall, a modern hotel, clean, comfortable, reasonably well-appointed but not strong on Parisian charm and in an unattractive area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, everything you'd expect for the level of value”
Reviews.Author: rich_coleman
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Mercure Montmartre for a 2-night weekend break in August. The hotel represents excellent value for Paris, and is in a convenient location just a few minutes walk from the Metro. It's at the foot of the Montmartre hill, just down the road from the Moulin Rouge (less than 5 mins), and in the opposite direction there are some bars / cafés and restaurants around Place de Clichy that are quite handy. We had little difficulty walking up through Montmartre to the Sacré Coeur on Sunday morning (about 20 mins). The hotel itself is clean, modern, and pretty much exactly what you'd expect from a mid-range chain hotel in Paris. Nothing amazing, but sometimes it's nice to know what you're getting in advance. The rooms were a decent enough size, comfortable bed, standard decor, and with a handy fridge (rather than a minibar they had a widely-stocked vending machine downstairs). They seem to have had an art-themed refurb, so each floor is dedicated to a famous artist (we were on the 5th floor, dedicated to Van Gogh), with a variety of related paintings decorating the hotel etc - it was a nice touch. Our limited dealings with the staff (mostly just front-desk) were fine; they were courteous and efficient, but friendly enough as well. Overall I would recommend the hotel. It's not exactly in the middle of the action, but it's not hard to get to the action if that's what you want, and in the meantime you have a clean, modern hotel at a good price for central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: discoverourworld
Reviews.Content: service-excellent location to subway-excellent area-not the "romantic" Paris but that is just a few subway stops away room- big compared to other European cities..very convenient fridge in the room free buffet-we filled up on this and ate just one other meal safety-no issues on our trip

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LouPotato
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at the Mercure Montmatre during June as part of a Air Transat Vacations package. The price was so low (less that we spent on airfare alone to Italy two years ago) that we told ourselves that the hotel was more or less free and that we wouldn't complain about it. By the end of our week we were quite pleased that we in fact had nothing to complain about. The hotel itself is what I would call a budget business class hotel (akin to an urban Holiday Inn in North America) housed in a fairly nondescript modern building. It has zero charm but is well maintained, functional and the rooms are large enough with all the expected features. We actually had a view of the golden dome of the Invalides and the Eieffel tower off in the distance! If you want a view make sure you're on at least the fifth floor and facing in the right direction. Try to avoid the viewless first floor which is just down the hall from the noisy breakfast room and various meeting halls. Our package included a full breakfast: scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, pastries, cereal, fruit, yogurt, cheese, bread etc.... and most importantly excellent coffee! Certainly no complaints here, but I think if it had not been included in our package we wouldn't have paid the 17 euros but instead would have gone to one of the nearby cafes. There's not much else to say about the hotel itself except to mention that it's lack of charm is easily made up for by the friendly and extremely helpful front desk staff who were always happy to assist us non-French speakers with restaurant reservations and other requests. I've been to a couple of 5 stars whose front desks were far less useful. In terms of location, the hotel is on the edge of Montmartre rather then in the central core of Paris where you'll probably be spending most of your time. It's true that it's fairly close to a rather seedy area along the Boulevard de Clichy (the Moulin Rouge is here), but it's just as close to the best part of Montmartre...Rue Joseph de Maistre, Rue des Martyres, Rue des Abbesses, Rue Lepic etc where it's non-touristy yet filled with wonderful restaurants, patisseries, bistros etc. We could have happily come here every night for dinner. If you really want the full tourist experience Place de Tetre and Sacre Cour are no more then a 15-20 minute walk away. If you prefer a hotel where many of the great sites of Paris are an easy walk from your front door, this isn't the place. Nonetheless, there's plenty of nearby public transit. Almost at the front door is the stop for bus 95 which will take you to Gallerie Lafayette, the Opera, the Louvre (about 20 minutes) and St Germain de Pres. Next to it is the stop for bus 30 which passes by Parc Monceau and the Arch de Triomphe/Champs Elysees on its way to the Trocedero across the river from the Eiffel Tower. We'd also see bus 80(?) passing by which travels along the Seine past Nortre Dame on its way to Ville de Cite (close to the Pompideau Centre) but we never figured out where its stop was! Instead we took a short stroll to Place de Clichy where we had two subway lines to take us anywhere we wanted to go. So in the end, if you book at a good price and if you're willing to forgo an element of Parisian charm you should have no problem with the Mercure Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, seedy location”
Reviews.Author: WindsorRosemary
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there in June. The hotel itself was great - nice rooms, good service, friendly staff, great buffet breakfast. The problem was that the hotel is near A LOT of sex shops along one street (the street the Moulin Rouge is on) and the atmosphere was therefore not what we were expecting - i.e., boulangeries and patisseries!! Of course, there are a lot of other great streets in the area, but we've decided not to stay in this hotel again because of the seediness of this one street. Also, there was one patisserie on the same street - more of a Middle Eastern one, and the pastries were HORRIBLE!! The service was even worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Samanabound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in the second week of May/09 and were happy with both the hotel and the location. It is very close to a main subway line and once you figure out you are on the "blue' line it was easy to get back and forth to any of the sights - (just remember to always look for the station at the END of the line to know you are going in the right direction). We had breakfast included and while it was busy some days there was always a place to sit - I noticed some people complained about the service on Tripadvisor but we had no problems at all - it is a buffet after all and not a full service resturant! There are plenty of resturants around the area/Macdonalds down the street for free wi-fi and a middle eastern takeout spot across the road if your in a hurry...5 euro's for a filling meal - cant go wrong! You can walk to the Moulin Rouge from the hotel as well as all of Montmarte's sights...be warned though its a lot of uphill so take it easy if you are unfit or have health issues...if thats the case just head over to the subway no biggie. We found several grocery stores/boulangeries and bought wine/cheese/juice and water to keep in our room fridge. Overall a clean but no frills hotel in a good location and for the price definately worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Penelope1970
Reviews.Content: My cousin and myself stayed at this hotel from May 8th,2009-May 15th. The reception staff was fantastic, smilling and delighted to help if approached politely. The room was clean and adequate. I loved the efficiency of this hotel. For example rather than putting an iron in each and every room, there is an ironing room on the 5th floor open 24/7. The breakfast was included in our package price and we always found something to start the day with, although I must admit that I would not have payed the listed price of 17 euro for it. We were warned by Transat Vacations that there would be construction going on from 9-5 on weekdays-we never saw it and on the odd day that we were in the room between those hours, we had to be very quiet and listen to be able to hear a faint knocking. The location is fantastic with the Place Clichy Metro stop about 300M away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adaquate”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Austen
Reviews.Content: Just a short review: Found it on trip advisor - smaller , more highly rated hotels were fully booked even though it was a Sunday/Monday night booking. Felt their rates were reasonable. Front desk staff were friendly/polite. Bar was a mess with plenty of empty tables, but all covered in dirty glasses. Room was exactly what you'd expect from this type of hotel: - Perfectly adaquate.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: ezhus
Reviews.Content: Location is great and standard of room was good, but service was very poor. On arrival the face on the receptionist was miserable and the greeting was lacklustre. I booked through hotels.com, but the receptionist said the fee I had paid was too cheap and asked for more money, which I refused. I was given a room reluctantly after asking for my money back. On check-out, I was asked to pay for my room, despite having presented my voucher on arrival!

Reviews.Title: “medium value for the price”
Reviews.Author: morcal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, the rooms are clean quite small but all basics are there. The service at the reception was not a great experience, let say that the price is ok for a 3 star hotel in that location but the service is far below the average. I recommend not to have breakfast in the hotel 16 euros and not even a real coffee.. for that price you can have great breakfasts in a cosy brasserie so typic in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a city-trip”
Reviews.Author: Clerkie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet good situated, not far away from Montmartre and with a public parking just aside of it. The hotel itself is quiet big but the rooms are very comfortable, clean and spacies. The staff is very friendly and helpfull with your questions about Paris. The breakfast room is a large room with a lot of tourists around but overall the breakfast itself is good. Conclusion is that you can't find anything wrong about this hotel and Mercure delivers a standard quality hotel that fits exactly for tourists and business-people!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rover54
Reviews.Content: This a relatively modern hotel and was clean and tidy. After some variable hotel experiences in Paris in the past, this time we opted for a modern 'chain' hotel for a more predictable quality of stay and we weren't disappointed. The metro station just outside the hotel has lines going direct to the Arc de Triomphe, the other end of the Champs Elysees and the Gare du Nord. The Moulin Rouge is two minutes walk away and Sacre Coeur about 15 minutes walk. There are also a number of restaurants and cafes close by. The area beyond the Moulin Rouge, for a couple hundred yards, does have a few sex shops and 'shows', but these wouldn't put us off staying here again. The area does not feel unsafe and this stretch of road could be avoided to walk anywhere. Although this hotel is in no way original or interesting, it does offer a good combination of value, quality and convenient location. We would stay here again without hestation.

Reviews.Title: “Summer in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DreamerToronto
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Great location. Wonderful breakfast included.This was part of a Transat Holiday Package.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jillypink
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, around the corner from the Moulin Rouge and close to lots of restaurants. I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of a tour. The travel agent requested room with a disabled bathroom. However on arrival, the hotel did not have any rooms with disabled bathrooms. I found this amazing as all other Mercures I have stayed have have these facilities. Staff were helpful but I would not stay at this hotel again. The Ibis next door had rooms with disabled bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean”
Reviews.Author: rob3066
Reviews.Content: We wanted a reasonable hotel with good public transport links into the city, not too far out with a car park close by. This Hotel fitted the bill. Situated within a few mins walk of the Moulin Rouge, the Metro and bus links and adjacent to a public underground car park, it seemed perfect for us. Took us 17 mins to get out of Paris by car. Car Park was expensive as you can imagine, 60euros for 3 days. Hotel was clean and rooms were what you would expect for this class of accomodation. There is a bar in the hotel and restaurant serving breakfast. However, we had breakfast in one of the numerous bars a few minutes away at half the cost. We purchased a 2 day deal on open top bus tours which go very close to the hotel. This provided all the city transport we needed, apart from one ride on the Metro. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, something we find very useful. Internet cafe next door, cheaper than using the hotel services. About 20 mins easy walk to the Sacre-Coeur. Plenty of nearby restaurants, some expensive, some reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ludditte
Reviews.Content: Modern 3 stars hotel, close to the Sacre-Coeur. A 2 minutes walk from the closest Metro station (place de Clichy) on line 13 and line 2 one takes you right to the Champs Elysees and les Invalides. The other one goes to l'Arc de Triomphe or le Pere Lachaise cemetary. Rooms are quite comfy and all have a safety deposit box. The bathtubs are huge by french standards. Staff is friendly and the included breakfast is decent. I would not hesitate to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eng_Pepi
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location, and also price (around 160EUR / night, with breakfast, which is not bad for Paris). The hotel is in Monmartre, in a walking distance from the Moulin Rouge area - nice from a touristic point of view, specially if you don't have kids and enjoy some fun on being approached every 10 meters by a guy/girl inviting you to enter a peep-show house, or an erotic shop... But all very un-annoying and without any problem... The hotel is very nice (has some modernisation works going, but no problem) - modern, efficient and nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HertsToWorld
Reviews.Content: Great location, Metro just a few minutes walk. Interesting and easy walk into Montmartre and to Sacre Coeur. From our 7th floor room we could see Sacre Coeur to the left and the Eiffel Tower to the right, just a brilliant view. Breakfast room got a bit hectic around 9.30, but between 8.00 and 9.00 we virtually had it to ourselves. Hotel is right next to Monmartre Cemetery which is surprisingly interesting and worth a visit to see tombs of literary and artistic figures including Foulcault, Degas, Berlioz, Nijinsky, Adolphe Sax (as in inventor of the saxophone, yes really) and many others.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a bit disappointing, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MadridWings
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because the company I work for has an agreement with the Accor chain, which this hotel belongs to. I chose it because, among all the Accor hotels in Paris, it offered the best location for the lowest price. It is located just off Place de Clichy, a place not so inspiring because congested with traffic, but very convenient since it's just at the foot of the Montmartre hill, very close to the Moulin Rouge (if you're into that kind of shows - we weren't) and to several station. The hotel looks horrible from the outside. Unfortunately, among all the old buildings along the street, it occupies part of a huge ugly white concrete block, which hosts an unispiring shopping centre, a car parking and an Ibis hotel as well as the Mercure. As you enter the hall you feel relieved as you realise it actually looks like a hotel inside! I had never been to a Mercure so I didn't really know what to expect. The pictures on the website looked really nice, but they are supposed to, aren't they? All in all the hotel is good, it is quite basic, but you probably won't need many frills in a city like Paris, which will keep you busy for most of the day and tire you so much that you will be sleeping by 10pm... Anyway, some of the reception staff were really nice and approachable, some others less so, the common areas are basic, with just a couple of sofas and a small bar (we didn't have breakfat at the hotel so I can't comment on that). The room was basic too, with plain furnishing, the toilet was OK, the beds not so comfortable. The best part was definitely the view. As the building has 8 or 9 floors you might want to ask for a top floor room overlooking the city. We didn't ask for one, but they allocated one to us and it was absolutely amazing. We could see most of Paris from the 7th floor, with the Tour Eiffel flashing at night. The room also featured a mini bar and a free safe, which we loved. I must say we enjoyed our stay. It was our first time in Paris so we probably weren't much interested in a fancy hotel. The Mercure did its purpose, it was well located, functional and clean. The full price for a room is hefty in my opinion, but it probably reflects normal prices for that category in Paris. We paid much less due to the discount I got so I didn't investigate it. Be aware of the bill anyway. We decided not to have breakfast at the hotel and so we said at check-in but at check out we were charged for breakfast every day. Additionally, we were charged for bar items we didn't take. The lady at reception was really nice and polite and eventually charged us the correct amount, but make sure you don't get charged for breakfast if you don't want it. Also be aware that if you accidentally move any contents of the bar, a sensor will indicate that you've taken it and will automatically charge you for that item (!)

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure Paris Montmartre
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Rue Caulaincourt, 75018 Paris, France
